title.narrative: TMF Strengthening Human Rights Protection Project 2016-2020

description.narrative: Project of Strengthening Human Rights Protection under TMF supports rights holders in Chiang Rai, Nan, Payao and Chiang Mai and other provinces community with knowledge and awareness raising, community networks strengthening, and advocacy for government policy and law. The target rights holders with about 150,000 people in Chiang Rai encounter problems on personal legal status and citizenship, accessing to the government services and justice as they lack of knowledge on their legal rights in Thailand Project overall goal for protection of human rights for an equal society Project’s objective 1) Promote democratic culture and empower rights holders to protect their rights 2) Promote problem solving through democratic culture and justice process 3) Create environment for CSO for movement and network Expected result in: 1) Rights’ holder formed network to bargain power for right’s protection 2) Right’s holder protect their social and economic 3) Lobbied policy and law to improve human rights protection 4) Right’s holder access to justice process 5) Increased human right’s volunteers and networks 6) Strengthening human rights issues to public and society The project activities to establish community and legal networks, with voluntary leaders and volunteer lawyers. Campaigns to increase knowledge and empower communities. Annual forums, public working groups to push rights protection policy. Have legal consultation and advices. Media and publication to educate about human rights to society Focused thematic areas include legal status and citizenship, local democratic culture, access to justice and others basic human rights  Other stakeholder including Local government agencies, NGO networks, Academic Institutions, and Lawyer Networks
This project mainly contributes to results within Empowerment of human rights defenders. Results will be reported later in the Global Civsam grant period 2016-2020
